Title: Senior Application Specialist
Description:
Overview:
Job Summary:

This position reports to the Director of Professional Services.
The Data Specialist is primarily responsible for analyzing and transforming client ERP system data (HR/Pay/Finance) and successfully converting it from one database to another.
Responsibilities:
Duties & Responsibilities:

Preparation of database shells for atrieveERP HR, payroll and finance products.
Analyze, cleanse, map and transform data for import into atrieveERP Finance systems (GL, Journal Entries, Budget, A/P Vendor, A/R Customer, POs, Data Dictionary). Validate client data to ensure required files and fields have been extracted. Provide conclusions from the data for decision making purposes. Create and maintain documentation on conversion process.
Analyze, cleanse, map and transform data for import into atrieveERP HR systems (Position code, assignment type, evaluation types, subjects, certifications (class and type), Absences). Validate client data to ensure required files and fields have been extracted. Provide conclusions from the data for decision making purposes. Create and maintain documentation on conversion process.
Analyze, cleanse, map and transform data for import into atrieveERP Payroll systems (Employee demographics, tax detail, banking information, Job codes, rates of pay, hours, Earnings, Deductions, Entitlements, allowances, etc.). Validate client data to ensure required files and fields have been extracted. Provide conclusions from the data for decision making purposes. Create and maintain documentation on conversion process.
Move data from staging environments to live servers.
Work closely with clients and project teams to ensure the data is accurate and accessible
Ensure that conversions are completed on time, on budget
Reconcile converted data to original (record counts, balancing monetary totals, etc).
Analyze data issues and recommend ‘best practice’ solutions to clients and project teams.
Update and communicate conversion project status to management, project team and clients.
Develop application knowledge in Finance, Payroll and HR products to support the implementation cycle
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
Skills Required:

Excellent knowledge of Database concepts, methods, and techniques. Knowledgeable in relational database theory and the ability to apply this knowledge to products.
Excellent knowledge of current information system standards and data management practices.
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills that rely on a structured approach to problem solving.
Strong written communication skills; Candidates must be able to document conversion and migration outcomes.
Experience working directly with customers / users to ensure that the correct data is received and that questions are answered
Ability to work under pressure with tight deadlines. Ability to manage and work on multiple projects with short cycles.
Education & Experience Required:

Diploma/Degree Computer Science or its equivalent in proven database work experience.
2-5 years experience in a related or similar role.
Experience in business-related IT environment.
Proficient in Excel, Word and Power Point.
Experience with ETL tools (preferably Pentaho Data Integration) would be an asset.
Experience writing queries (SQL).
Experience with VMS would be an asset.
Background with ERP / HR, Payroll and Finance data would be an asset.
EEO Commitment:
PowerSchool is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. PowerSchool is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. Our inclusive culture empowers PowerSchoolers to deliver the best results for our customers. We not only celebrate the diversity of our workforce, we celebrate the diverse ways we work. If you have a disability and need an accommodation regarding our recruiting process, please let us know by emailing TA@powerschool.com.

Title: Platform Engineering Lead - AI/ML
Description:
Job: Technology
Primary Location: ASEAN & South Asia-India-Bangalore
Schedule: Full-time
Employee Status: Permanent
Posting Date: 01/Jun/2020
Unposting Date: Ongoing
About Standard Chartered
We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.


To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.


We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.


Scope of Role
Position will be key to delivering a strategic programme called Client Analytics Platform (CAP) where we are building an AI and smart intelligence platform for a cloud-powered future. This will be a reliable, safe and secure advanced intelligence platform leveraging machine learning, analytics, and insights powered by artificial intelligence
This project has extremely senior visibility in the Bank and aims to deliver Delivers Relevant, Contextual Content to frontline staff, with content drawn from multiple internal & external sources. The platform will provide AI-Driven Client Insights, Opportunity Generation and Predictive Recommendations and connect front line staff with Strategic & Timely information to improve Client Outcomes.
The Role Responsibilities


In the role of artificial intelligence/machine learning platform engineering lead, you will join and lead our ML/AI platform team focusing on designing, implementing, and maintaining scalable features and services to support end-to-end ML/AI pipelines on CAP. You will work closely with the users, systems designers, and the developers. You will engage with engineering and operations teams to lead and develop machine learning solutions for a variety of tasks and projects using a multitude of tools and techniques. You will also be trusted advisor for best practice machine learning development. You will collaborate with the ML/AI algorithms team and other engineering teams to bring industry-leading machine learning solutions to the Banks RMs and Sales staff.

Responsibilities will include:
Lead the platform development teams to integrate ML tools/solutions to a high-performance production solution model
Architecting and developing machine learning solutions to productionise AI/ML models
Be comfortable with AI, ML, Big Data, Data Analytics and modelling
Be comfortable delivering cloud solutions with a micro services architecture
Be able to deliver integration with internal and external sources of data
Coordinating internal resources and vendors for the flawless execution of projects
Ensuring the project is delivered on-time, within scope and within budget
Report and escalate to management as needed
Perform risk management to minimize project risks
Our Ideal Candidate


Preferred Candidate Profile:

Ideal candidate must have proven credentials of delivering in world class engineering teams with the experience of creating a working machine learning-powered platform from the ground up. Candidate will define the end-to-end vision of our machine learning strategy as it relates to testing and product development, you will contribute innovative ideas and ingenious implementations to the team, and be capable of planning out scalable, maintainable data pipelines, services, and products. You will be interfacing with data scientists, engineering consumers, industry specialists, and business stakeholders through various areas of the Banks ecosystem. You must be a confident self-starter with ability to collaborate and devise end-to-end solutions. Relevant industry certifications are an added plus.

Must Have Core Competencies:
Great educational background, in the fields of computer science or engineering
Entrepreneurial minded, strong analytical problem-solving skills, and an aptitude for learning systems quickly.
Minimum five years of solid hands-on experience applying machine learning techniques to build models integrated into applications
Additional experience with data visualization, data analytics, and data mining
Strong software development skills with proficiency in Python
Experience with relational and non-relational databases; Postgres, Cassandra, MondoDB, etc
Experience with Big Data Technologies such as Kafka, Spark, or ElasticSearch
Experience in using distributed, highly available, low latency systems for analytics or data processing
5+ years in data structures, algorithms, highly concurrent programming, analysis of algorithm complexity
Experienced use of machine learning and statistical-analysis libraries, such as GraphLab Create, scikit-learn, scipy, NetworkX, Spacy and NLTK
High level of autonomy and influence to unblock delivery of results (evaluate and solve difficult problems involving various teams ranging from data instrumentation to analytics tool development)
A strong desire to establish standards of “Best Practice”
Ability to explain and present analyses machine learning concepts to a broad business and technical audience
Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending workshops; reviewing intranet/external publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional working groups
Experience in delivering projects in agile model
Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills
Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed
Maintains quality service by establishing and enforcing organization standards.
Provides periodic status reports to project working groups
Proven experience dealing with Risk & control related actions and artefacts to supporting internal audit
Highly Desired Additional Competencies:
Experience with architecture and design of RESTful based systems.
Development experience with cloud platforms such as Microsoft Azure or AWS
Experience with container technologies such as Docker, Singularity and Kubernetes
Design and implement scalable cloud-based web applications for PaaS, IaaS or SaaS
Experience in cloud development principles and patterns, particularly loosely coupled architectures and micro-services
Strong working knowledge of ML algorithms including decision trees, probability networks, association rules, clustering, regression, and neural networks
Experience with deep learning frameworks, such as mxnet, Torch, Caffe, and TensorFlow
Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.


To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages. We welcome conversations on flexible working.

Title: Global Process Analyst - Inventory to Fulfill, labeling - SA...
Description:
We, at H.B. Fuller embrace a shared set of beliefs and competencies that direct the way we operate and express our fundamental principles about how we will achieve success. We strive to hire talent that demonstrates our beliefs and our competencies.
POSITION OVERVIEW
The label specialist COE reports to the ITF COE Manager and has primary responsibility to support the BCS (Barcode Systems) and Bartender labeling systems for all labeling requirements in the production plants and warehouses. The specialist will be supporting the systems from a technical perspective and works on requests in the labeling area. The role will also provide support for the COE team as a subject matter expert in the area of labeling as SAP is rolled out to different businesses and regions. The support is provided to all global sites and support on our global SAP roll-out. Experience with SAP is required. Within this role, you will also provide support and input on process improvements across all the related teams (COE, Operations, Regulatory).


PRIMARY DUTIES
Support as a subject matter expert for all global plants operating with BCS/Bartender. The labeling specialists will be the first point of contact on (technical) issues and project related label design. They will be able to help drive improvements and efficiency in the processes around labeling as well as supporting internal and external customers.
Analyzing and resolving issues.
Working to design, construct, and test label applications
Training of Super Users and End Users on the BCS process and application.
Work with the COE project labeling specialist
Supporting several plant improvements (e.g.):
o Load balancing for servers
o Automation of production lines for labeling
Supporting new BCS implementations
H.B. Fuller is currently implementing SAP worldwide. SAP interfaces with the BCS labeling system as the global template. Bartender is implemented at multiple locations but is to be phased out. Support on Bartender is still needed and activities for that includes the migration from Bartender to BCS. Knowledge of SAP is required to be able to support locations during the roll outs.

Support business specialist on design, testing & maintain the HBF labels & templates according to the standards within the labeling process
Support in creating or modify HBF labels & templates.
Support in creating or modify customer specific templates.
Support in creating or modify HBF pre-printed labels.
Support for maintenance in obsolete labels & templates in both BCS and Bartender.
Support business specialist on design, test & maintain the Customer Branded templates according to the approved customer specification

Data gathering & feasibility check (especially with facility & pack constraints).
Making sure all data is transferred to the label systems from the ERP system.
Questions about label templates.
Technical support
SAP ABAP work (with developer) for the extract programs that feed into the labeling systems.
o Updating programs based on requested changes
o Performance review and propose improvements
o Data field enhancements, aligning with the label systems
SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) design and coding.
Transfer Bartender to BCS as BCS is going to be the global template


Management of change
Analysis of needs (equipment; IT; labels & templates; regulatory etc.), anticipating the changes that may be required short/long term and work on solutions.
Feasibility & scope (on above & data)
Once approved test, implement & maintain
Work with super users for labeling, work with the other labeling specialists.

Backup
As one of the labeling specialists provide backup to the other specialist globally in case of PTO and holidays. Currently the specialists are located in the US and Europe.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

4-year Degree Chemistry, Engineering, Manufacturing or related sciences.
2+ years of experience
Valid passport
Able to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram or schedule form
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Previous experience in labeling software
Knowledge of a Chemical production facility
Able to deal with internal and external customers with tact and poise
Ability to organize workload, determine priorities and establish and monitor deadlines
Good attention to detail
Able to change priorities when necessary
Proficiency in a wide variety of computer software:
SAP, SAP ABAP
Bartender
BCS; T-Former
Prism; TKS
ChemGES
MS Office;
Ability to learn and use new computer systems
Language skills:
English fluently written and spoken

PHYSICAL ENVIRONMENT
Standard office atmosphere

Title: Sr Operations Analysis Analyst
Description:
Department Overview
IHS Markit DeltaOne is specialist provider of managed and installed data services, delivering world-class data, technology and service solutions focusing on the complex and evolving Index and ETF data needs. Used in the front, middle and back office by the world’s leading Investment Banks, Asset Managers, Fund Administrators, Prime Brokers and Hedge Funds.
Position Summary
The successful candidate will play a key part in maintaining the smooth running of the day-to-day operations of DeltaOne solutions data offering and working with cross functional teams to identify solutions in problem areas to remove operational inefficiencies. On the data enhancement aspect, the candidate will use advanced Excel, VBA and SQL skills translating operational requirements into technical solutions and tools. The team operates 24/7, thus interested candidates will be required to work in the all shifts including US hours on a rotational basis.
Duties & Accountabilities
Validate the accuracy of data received from various sources. Ensure that this information is stored in databases and is accurately reflected on products by creating or running data quality checks and standards.
Ensure the quality and time-efficient production of financial information to respective products.
Respond to data queries from both internal and external clients and provide support to stakeholders.
Monitor and research market events in order to anticipate changes. Ensure a deep understanding of the markets and business events.
Work with and involve cross functional teams to provide Root Cause Analysis to identify solutions in problem areas.
Consolidate information around the dataset leading to the establishment of best practices.
Perform automated/semi-automated checks to ensure production of high quality content.
Ensure MOW’s are documented and maintained.
Coordinate and Delegate work as per team requirements
Identify data quality improvement projects, and good design practices
Intermediate Excel and SQL skills, including being able to write basic SQL queries.
Proven ability to utilize data and systems tools available
Good verbal, written, and presentation skills
Education & Experience
Graduate degree/ Post Graduate or equivalent in ideally Finance, Economics, Business, Computer Science.
The candidate should have a good understanding of equities & capital markets. Specific knowledge around Index/ETF and Corporate Actions highly preferred.
2 to 4 years of business operations experience and must be flexible in addressing dynamic business needs.
Must have a strong interest in finance and also be up to date with current global financial market news.
The candidate must be a self-starter, able to take on multiple tasks at a time, hardworking, and efficient.
Must demonstrate superior communication skills and is expected to interact professionally across business units within the company.
Being a team player is a vital aspect of the position, and it is expected that the candidate will work well individually, as well as in a global team environment.
Flexible to work with Rotational shifts
Company overview
IHS Markit is a leading, global financial information services company, the company provides independent data, valuations and trade processing across all asset cl asses in order to enhance transparency, reduce risk and improve operational efficiency. Its client base includes the most significant institutional participants in the financial marketplace. For more information, please see https://ihsmarkit.com/

Title: Associate (Fresher) Incident Management Specialist
Description:
Vista is the world's leading PE firm for Enterprise Software and recently invested $1B in the Reliance Digital Platform. As part of the Vista portfolio, Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a NYC-headquartered global technology and data company that builds verification, optimization, and analytics solutions for the advertising industry. We are seeking an Associate Incident Management Specialist to join our Customer Excellence team in Pune. You will work closely with the team to communicate cross-departmentally, providing input into processes and planning, to help drive internal improvements post-incident. You will build relationships quickly and drive escalations in this fast-paced environment.
This is an awesome opportunity to learn and grow! If you are excited by technology that has the power to handle hundreds of thousands of transactions per second; collect tens of billions of events each day; and evaluate thousands of data-points in real-time all while responding in just a few milliseconds, then IAS is the place for you!
Please note, this is an entry/junior level requirement. We are not seeking a heavily experienced candidate.
What you'll learn and do:
Incident management governance
Manage the detection, assignment, escalation and recording of incidents
Monitor incident progress by priority
Chair post-mortem meetings & follow-ups
KPI tracking along with creation and presentation of metrics and reporting
Training, evaluation and delivering
Find creative solutions; process automation and improvement opportunities
Operations support
You should apply if you have most of this:
0-1 years prior Incident Management experience
Ability to think through difficult issues and provide advice or when necessary, seek advice
Ability to use sound judgement to resolve issues and make recommendations, and remediations
Initiative and passion to drive all incidents to resolution, ensuring timely participation by all stakeholders
Without hesitation, escalate issues to upper management, to include C-Level managers, in accordance with prescribed procedures
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
Team player having the ability to work effectively in a team environment and with all levels
What puts you over the top:
Experience in Agile/Scrum or related collaborative workflow
Experience with Google G-Suite, Jira, Slack, and video conferencing such as Bluejeans
Some Incident Management and Incident communication experience
AdTech Experience and/or SaaS environment
Flexible work hours and possible weekend work
ITILv4 Foundations Certification
About Integral Ad Science
Integral Ad Science (IAS) is the global market leader in digital ad verification, offering technologies that drive high-quality advertising media. IAS equips advertisers and publishers with both the insight and technology to protect their advertising investments from fraud and unsafe environments as well as to capture consumer attention, and drive business outcomes. Founded in 2009, IAS is headquartered in New York with global operations in 17 offices across 13 countries. IAS is part of the Vista Equity Partners portfolio of software companies. For more on how IAS is powering great impressions for top publishers and advertisers around the world, visit integralads.com.

Title: Sr Analyst Demand Management
Description:
Req. ID: 215667

Micron Technology’s vision is to transform how the world uses the information to enrich life and our dedication to people, innovation, tenacity, partnership, and customer focus allows us to fulfill our mission to be a global leader in memory and storage solutions. This means conducting business with integrity, accountability, and partnership while supporting our global community
Job Responsibilities
The Global Supply Chain (GSC) team at Micron is looking for a multifaceted and motivated individual for the role of the Demand Management Specialist/Analyst. The role is an opportunity for a motivated individual to utilize his or her analytical, business and process/project management skills to monitor, analyze and improve the quality of forecasts that drive Micron’s Supply Chain activities.
In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing, performing quality checks, monitoring demand forecasts and related inputs. You will learn a lot about the demand side of the semiconductor industry by uploading, updating and distributing demand changes to all the required stakeholders. You will prepare reports, monitor the demand signal, track forecast accuracy and communicate exception lists that are needed to the operations of Micron.
You will play an active role in the overall Demand Management Solutions deployment where you will be a go-to-expert for demand management related activities including in UAT (User-Acceptance Testing), validating & analyzing data, working with IT on system issues and ensure resolutions are acquired, conducting training to cross-functional teams, etc.
In addition, you will collaborate with teams through positive relationship and co-ownership in achieving overall company and GSC Performance Indicators, including Demand Management related metrics, while consistently evaluating opportunities and supporting process updates to improve overall performance. The Demand Management team interfaces actively with various teams in Micron, including teams from Sales, Marketing, NPI, IT, Data Science, Global Supply Chains, Order Promising, Order Management (Customer Sales Support & Order Fulfillments), Backend planning and Finished Goods.
Requirements
Total 10 years of experience in including Supply Chain and team management.
Relevant 5 years in Demand Planner/Management.
A high level of amenity in working with numbers with advance data analytics knowledge and skills will be optional plus
Problem-solving – use appropriate knowledge, including outstanding excel skills and other tools (Tableau, R, SQL, HANA, RPA, etc.) and methods to report exceptions.
Excellent written and verbal communication as well as presentation and PowerPoint skills
Able to work effectively in a team environment with multi-functional teams and possess excellent interpersonal skills
Experience in continuous improvement initiatives along with day-to-day business operations will be a plus.
A fast, detail-focused individual who can come up to speed quickly on the overall supply chain and several detailed processes. Possess the experience and capability to train others on these same detailed processes
Education
Bachelor’s degree preferred in the field of Industrial Engineering, analytics or statistics APICS Certification will be an added advantage

Join an inclusive team focused on one thing: using their expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for customers and partners. The solution we build helps make everything from virtual reality experiences to breakthroughs in neural networks possible. We do it all while committing to integrity, sustainability, and giving back to our communities. Because doing so can spark the very innovation we are pursuing.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Keywords: Hyderabad || Telangana (IN-TG) || India (IN) || Supply Chain || Experienced || Regular || Supply Chain/Logistics || #LI-RR1 || Tier 4 ||

Excellent written and spoken communication skills and English language knowledg

Title: Lead, Business Solution
Description:
Job: Technology
Primary Location: ASEAN & South Asia-India-Bangalore
Schedule: Full-time
Employee Status: Permanent
Posting Date: 23/Jul/2020
Unposting Date: Ongoing

About Standard Chartered
We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. With more than 86,000 employees from 125 different countries around the world, we are strong believers of getting right talents with diverse ideas, cultures and backgrounds to build better products and services.
We are changing the way we do business – becoming the digital bank with a human touch. This is your opportunity to be part of a growth story in an industry that is reimagining how customers are getting better, faster experiences and convenience through digital technology. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.
We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture.
About Global Banking Technology & Our Value Proposition
Global Banking Technology services Corporate, Institutional, Commercial and Financial Institution clients with technology solutions catered to teams of relationship managers and product specialists. We offer a suite of technology platforms for functions like Client Enablement & Corporate Finance, Credit Origination, Client Lifecycle & Document Management, Lending, Client Documentation among others. We are a team of talented, diverse technologists who champion change, excellence and stewardship.
With our platform estate that includes mobile solutions on a varied tech stack, Global Banking Technology offers the best learning opportunities for any dynamic self-starter. We follow agile methodology and you will actively participate in all aspects of solution engineering & engage with business stakeholders as applicable. Together with a group of highly driven technologists, you will get to collaborate and work on solutions that provide the best digital experiences and continually enhance existing offerings. Innovation is a big part of our execution agenda as we strive for excellence. If you are a curious technologist and tackling challenges excites you, then a role in Global Banking Technology is the right fit for you.
Role Overview

Job Title

Global Banking Function

Location


Lead, Business Solutions

Banking Platform and Integration services (BPSI)

Bangalore


Description of the Role

This role in Global Banking Technology is within BPSI for the position of Lead, Business Solutions. Position will be key to strategic programme – Banking platform interfaces and services, that will be a global banks servicing layer for data domain interfaces. Lead, Business Solutions role is to drive BPSI digital vision, identification & ownership of BPSI product backlog, stakeholder management and most importantly accountability of business KPIs.
Preferred Candidate Profile

Ideal candidate must have proven credentials of delivering in world class engineering teams. With a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, engineering or equivalent discipline, he/she must have relevant experience fulfilling responsibilities of the position. Must be a confident self-starter with ability to collaborate and devise solutions. Relevant industry certifications are added plus. Ability to learn and adapt to new technologies and frameworks is required.
As a Lead, Business Solutions, your main responsibilities will involve:
Set ambitious & clear product vision and communicate it effectively to stakeholders, the team and the rest of the bank
Works closely with CPO to establish each product's business value & support messaging, communication and customer outreach as necessary
Product demand management
Accountable for product specific KPIs once solution enters production and communicate regular tracking to stakeholders
As the functional domain expert, engages with data domain owners around requirements, opportunities and gaps
Good skills at facilitation, situational awareness, conflict resolution, continual improvement, empowerment, and increasing transparency.
Coordinates and facilitates agile ceremonies (Refinement/Grooming, Sprint planning, Sprint Demo/Review, Sprint Retrospective and Daily stand-up meetings)
Identifying process inefficiencies and working with Scrum teams and Project Managers on improvements
Utilize market and industry knowledge to translate user needs into user stories and acceptance criteria for their team. Maintain a backlog 3 to 4 sprints ahead of the team
Integrates usability studies and research into product requirements to enhance user satisfaction and ensure customer driven design
Facilitates release planning with stakeholders as well as weekly demos
Keep abreast with Bigdata/Analytics best practices and new trend

Core Competencies

Strongly Desired competencies:
Ability to translate business-to-technical requirements, and vice versa
Feature prioritization and road map planning
Defining and tracking success metrics
Conducting customer interviews and user testing
Mapping and understanding complex competitive, partner, and customer ecosystems
Basic data modelling, JSON, XML, working knowledge of relational and non-relational databases. SQL, REST APIs, processing data using Python
Creative problem solver, able to build contingency plans and handle stressful situation with professionalism.
Deep analytical skills and the ability to see the connections between layers of business operations
Ability to master and become expert analyst of platform, its function and system
Good understanding of software development lifecycle using Agile/Waterfall models
Applicable knowledge of the technologies used by the team to implement agile methodologies.

Preferred competencies
Familiarity with Big Data Engineering solutions and architecture
Experience with various analytics tools, and business intelligence tool
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Effective meeting design and facilitation; LUMA & more
Experience with Human Centric Design principles
Effective communicator at C-Level by developing consistent and compelling storylines
Excellent proficiency in English is mandatory, additional languages are an asset
Knowledge and/or experience with Agile techniques
Experience playing the Scrum Master role

If you’re a bright mind with big ambitions, we’ll actively encourage you to fulfil your potential. Thanks to our rich and varied international footprint, we can offer exciting opportunities working across different countries and cultures. Apply Now and take the next step in fulfilling your potential.

Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.


To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages. We welcome conversations on flexible working.

Title: HR Solutions Specialist
Description:
Business Process Analyst, HR

About Syngenta:

Syngenta is a leading agriculture company helping to improve global food security by enabling millions of farmers to make better use of available resources. Through world class science and innovative crop solutions, our 28,000 people in over 90 countries are working to transform how crops are grown. We are committed to rescuing land from degradation, enhancing biodiversity and revitalizing rural communities.

Purpose:
The BPA HR will support at least 3 to 4 process towers (HR Administration, Organization Management, Total Compensation, Recruitment, Talent Development, Learning and Development, and Performance Management) by providing analysis and consultation on the use of the approved HR data model. Specifically the incumbent will:
The key technology skill required for this profile would be Workday – at least 3 years of work experience in workday configuration, preferably from implementation to steady state
Experience in Configuration of business processes within workday
Screen all assigned processes for risks, issues and opportunities for sustainable improvements. Identify continuous improvement opportunities
Provide analysis and support to approved HR projects, to include testing scenario development and requisite data maintenance.
Work with Business Process Consultants to review new processes and also improve existing business processes
Translate business requirements into requirement specifications to enable the delivery of technically sustainable solutions
Manage process documentation as an important part of the overall enterprise business architecture

Guide the HR Services teams and their strategic partners through HR MDM process change management.
Design, develop and maintain security roles
Perform analysis for reporting/audit requests
Communicate and translate workday authorization requirements among business process owners.
Compliance and Security related policies, procedures, control sets, and best practices.
Experiential knowledge of workday upgrades, project management and experience in partner management
the candidate should be willing to support time zones and work in shifts

About this Job:

List any Functional or Leadership Competency related specifically to this job
Judgment: Analyzes information, guidelines, and requirements from different sources to evaluate alternatives and make effective judgments. Draws accurate, useful conclusions from financial, business, and quantitative information. Makes timely and sound decisions on everyday issues and problems by applying accurate logic, appropriate knowledge, expertise, and common sense.
Execution & Results Orientation: Manages work and work performance, holding everyone accountable to effectively and efficiently completing work responsibilities. Demonstrates initiative and a strong commitment to achieving meaningful results, meeting or exceeding goals, and acting on opportunities to create value.
Collaboration: Fosters a sense of collaboration and works effectively with others across the organization, including in a remote team working environment, to achieve goals. Facilitates interaction of co-workers and external partners. Creates an environment for honest and open discussion of issues.
Consultancy: Has sound commercial awareness and the ability to provide insights and expertise for clients and project teams in the context of proposed solutions and approaches
Collaborative working: Contributes to the team and seeks ideas and efforts of team members to improve performance
Strategic insight: Diagnoses trends and critical relationships. Uses data, logical analysis and insight to pinpoint underlying issues
Communication: Engages and involves the listener by attending to their expressed concerns and needs
Stakeholder management: Develops relationships with key decision makers and influencers. Gains trust and respect of project teams and manages conflict
Service management: Recognizes customer needs and initiates actions to meet these

Qualifications

Essential Knowledge & Experience:
6-8 years of experience. Out of which 4 years into workday and rest could be other technologies like SAP, Taleo, Sum total, any other HR systems
At least 3-4 workday end-to-end implementation or steady state operations experience
Expertise in business process management, process design methodologies and techniques.
Ability to relate to both a process and service orientated environment and apply their associated principles to all aspects of work performed within
Critical technical, professional and personal capabilities
Certification in workday would be preferred

Qualifications:
Preferred Master’s General Management or IT , Bachelors in technology (BE, BCA, MCA)

Primary Location: India
Job: Business Process Management

Title: Business Strategy Consultant - Digital Strategy
Description:
Job Description
If you are passionate about business transformation using digital technologies and want to work as a consultant/advisor on revenue sharing basis, this is a great opportunity for you. We are looking for individuals with one or more specialization areas who have proven track record of implementing disruptive business models and digital 4.0 technologies in mid to large businesses across the globe.
Strategy consulting today requires the ability to see how business, technology and operations all intersect. At AideExpert Advisory you will work closely with exceptional strategy consulting team and an excellent market research team. Assisting our clients in creating and implementing digital visions, strategies and roadmaps that address today’s business needs and future growth

Flexibility in work timings
Opportunity to gain skills, knowledge and experience, together with highly marketable specialists
Opportunity to work with top clients in India and abroad across industries

Title: Senior Software Engineer - SAP QM
Description:
Together we make the difference
Siemens Mobility is an independent managed company of Siemens AG. Its core business includes rail vehicles, rail automation and electrification solutions, turnkey systems, intelligent road traffic technology and related services.
The Information Technology (IT) department has the global responsibility for the internal IT of Siemens Mobility. Its goal is to provide a robust and efficient IT landscape derived from business and market demands.
Your personality and individuality make the difference. In our team, we increase business performance and point the way into the digital age.
Is that exactly your thing? Then live your passion in an international and cross-location team in which you can actively shape the future of our company. You open up new possibilities for our customers with your competence. Connected with this is an exciting career path that leads you to ever new projects and solutions in the field of IT for Siemens Mobility.
Here's where you make the difference
You will be part of our IT Quality Management Department and will work closely together with other SAP IT teams. You will have good understanding of quality management processes and affinity to IT.
Your new role – challenging and future-oriented
As an IT professional, for QM processes in the SAP environment, you will be maintaining and further development/customizing and documentation of QM business processes over the entire value chain from development to production and sales.
Essentially, the processes of Mobility either are mapped using SAP QM or OPCenter Quality (formerly QSYS). For this purpose, you work in a team consisting of internal colleagues as well as external consultants / service providers.
In your area of responsibility, you will also advise users and specialists from the business sector on questions relating to process optimization in the area of quality management.
You also translate customer requirements into technical specifications and accompany the implementation up to the test and customer acceptance.
Permanent process optimization in this environment is essential in your area of responsibility.
Active participation in IT projects that affect the supervised process
You expect an environment with state-of-the-art working methods, agile methodologies and projects as well as intensive team spirit. Specifically, the consolidation of the Mobility SAP landscape and the introduction of the new SAP version S4 HANA are on the future roadmap.
Your qualifications – well-founded and adequate
The foundation of your professional success is a completed degree (Master/Diploma) in the field of IT, Computer Science or Business Informatics. Alternatively, you can have a comparable training in conjunction with corresponding additional qualifications.
You also have 5+ years of professional experience in the field of SAP quality management within a major technical group or also in IT consulting.
Well-founded and practically proven experience in SAP QM incl. Customizing knowledge are further cornerstones of your success.
Basic knowledge of logistics and manufacturing processes (MM, SD, PP) should be available.
Knowledge of ABAP, QM data structure and the corresponding technical understanding are also beneficial
Knowledge of interfaces like QM IDI and Business Workflow in regard to QM are beneficial.
With your communication skills and presentation skills, you can present technical issues clearly and intelligibly, even at management level.
If you also have fluent knowledge of English and are willing to travel, you are welcome in our team!

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

We’re Siemens. A collection of over 379,000 minds building the future, one day at a time in over 200 countries. We're dedicated to equality and we welcome applications that reflect the diversity of the communities we work in. All employment decisions at Siemens are based on qualifications, merit and business need. Bring your curiosity and imagination and help us shape tomorrow.
Find out more about mobility at: https://new.siemens.com/global/en/products/mobility.html and about Siemens careers at: www.siemens.com/careers

Organization: Siemens Mobility
Company: Siemens Technology and Services Private Limited
Experience Level: Mid-level Professional
Job Type: Full-time

Our Ideal Candidate

Strong Knowledge in Financial Accounting related implementation
Knowledge in SAP – FPSL, SAP – ABAP or any SAP product suites

Personal profile:

Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Computer Science or related field
Experience in working in intercultural teams
Excellent communications skills, fluency in English
Self-motivated, Delivery oriented individual with good time management
Facilitates collaboration and team player
Fast learner with good analytical skills to adapt to our dynamic environment
Proven capabilities in interacting with business users to gather requirements
Hands-on experience with large scale ERP implementation (SAP preferably)
Ability to work effectively under pressure, multi task, & build on unstructured formative situations
Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.


To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages. We welcome conversations on flexible working.

Title: HR Operations & Payroll Specialist
Description:
Company : Beckman Coulter India Pvt Ltd
Location : Mumbai
Position : HR Operations & Payroll Specialist
Reporting to: HR Leader – Diagnostics Division
Works with : External: Payroll, Statutory Compliances, Provident Fund, Actuarial, Auditors
Internal: HR Managers & Business Partners for all divisions of Beckman India, Recruitment, Finance, various Business Heads, Global C&B, Legal, etc.
Reportees : No direct reports. Responsible for delivery through partner teams

Summary of Role:
The Payroll function is responsible for successfully delivering accurate and timely payroll across all divisions in India in compliance with local laws and reporting requirements. You are the face of payroll that supports all employees and works closely with other HR functions, control partners and payroll and compliance vendors. We seek a talented and dynamic individual who has a control and compliance mindset with the ability to keep pace with the changing regulatory environment. You will inherit a function that is still evolving, which will require you to be hands-on in your approach. You will support a relatively small sized client group, but with complex challenges.

Specific Responsibilities that you would own:
A. Payroll Management, Statutory Compliances & Benefits Administration
Deliver accurate and timely payroll every month; Monitor vendor KPI and hold monthly review with payroll vendor, quarterly review with statutory compliance vendor
Report any control issue on a timely basis to direct reporting manager with resolutions
Run quarterly, half-yearly and annual processes: new payroll calendar, annual closing, taxation reconciliation, actuarial valuation and Benefits renewal, annual leave system closure and launch, etc.
Execute annual merit increases, bonus payments in the local payroll system while aligning on the approach with local HRMs and global C&B, where needed
Strive for operational excellence: lookout for ideas to increase performance, maintain a customer service focus to resolve queries from employees, other HR functions and control partners as well as external parties such as local tax authority, payroll vendors, etc.
Define, improve and implement Payroll related reporting and metrics for enhanced decision making

B. Annual Budgeting and Audit
Work closely with finance to ensure adequate monthly provisions and sufficient funds for a payroll run
Support salary budgeting and headcount projections for the business at an all India level
Lead and support monthly, quarterly, annual compliance audits and any internal reviews

C. Policy Definition and Process Management
Define and document payroll and benefit related policies, practices and reporting
Lead and manage vendor transitions, consolidation or services from action planning to employee communication and process launch
Identify key processes that can be centralized and managed by leveraging existing systems or vendor relationships e.g. on-boarding or exit process management
Uphold SLAs with our external partner(s) and engage with them on improvement measures to further streamline hand-offs between partners, improve accuracy and associate communication.
Define SLAs with our internal Stakeholder group across HR, Finance, Business & Function Head, establishing clear protocols for when a query managed and by whom vs. when is it escalated.

D. Communication & Stakeholder Management
Conduct monthly on-boarding calls, help desks and communication with exiting employees.
Provide regular updates for office-wide meetings, assist with ad hoc projects.
Enable resolution for employee escalations that are received on payroll, compliances or benefits
Engage the key stakeholder group of HR Managers, Business Partners and also Finance Controllers, on progress made on key imperatives and against the annual shared services plan

Qualification and Experience:
Knowledge of payroll principles, practices and procedures in India.
6-10 years of proven HR operations experience including payroll in a fast-paced environment
Experience of working in a global MNC & a matrixed working environment
Experience with payroll tax, benefits, including analyzing processes and controls, planning improvements, leading changes, payroll migration and managing priorities.
Experience and familiarity with Workday would be an added advantage

Capabilities needed to be successful:
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; willing to learn and assist others.
Result oriented, high on initiative with a need to deliver on time
Sense of urgency, attention to detail and quality standards
Ability to build and effectively manage interpersonal skills at all levels of the company
Ability to handle confidential data while maintaining high levels of integrity

Diversity & Inclusion:
At Danaher, we are dedicated to building and sustaining a truly diverse and inclusive culture. These are not just words on a page—Diversity and Inclusion is a top priority for the company, and it ties deeply to each of our core values. Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law.

Danaher Profile:
Danaher is a global science & technology innovator committed to helping our customers solve complex challenges and improve quality of life worldwide. Our world class brands are leaders in some of the most demanding and attractive industries, including life sciences, medical diagnostics, environmental and applied solutions. Our globally diverse team of approximately 67,000 associates is united by a common culture and operating system, the Danaher Business System, which serves as our competitive advantage. We generated $17.9B in revenue last year. We are ranked #161 on the Fortune 500 and our stock has outperformed the S&P 500 by more than 5,400% over 25 years.
At Danaher, you can build a career in a way no other company can duplicate. Our brands allow us to offer dynamic careers across multiple industries. We’re innovative, fast-paced, results-oriented, and we win. We need talented people to keep winning. Here you’ll learn how DBS is used to shape strategy, focus execution, align our people, and create value for customers and shareholders. Come join our winning team.
Danaher is committed to competitive compensation that typically has key components including base salary, variable annual incentive compensation based on personal and company performance, and long-term incentive.

Title: Pre-Sales Specialist
Description:
Job Description
We are looking for a motivated and self driven individual who is passionate about the benefits and value that our Analytical & Machine Learning platforms and other products/services bring to the business of our B2B clients. The person will work along with the sales and client engagement teams and front-end the technical engagement with B2B Enterprise Clients for all our enterprise platforms and offerings of Analytics Vidhya. The pre-sales specialist will be responsible for front-ending technical discussions and presentations with B2B clients and help sales team in closing deals in a timely manner with a faster/shorter sales cycle.

Skills Required
To assist the sales team with prospect opportunities with B2B Clients
To identify opportunities for how advanced technologies in the data science and machine learning space can benefit existing and future projects of clients and convert them into opportunities for Analytics Vidhya’s platforms, products and services offerings.
To apply logical common-sense pragmatism in order to understand and address Business requirements with appropriate technology choices
To be able to present complex technical concepts and ideas in a business forum appropriately
To be able to come up with ideas based on client’s needs and turn that into a potential product/platform opportunities
Excellent Client Engagement and Presentation Skills
Ability to understand use cases in various industries including BFSI, Telecom, E-commerce, O&G, Automotive, Pharma, Healthcare, Engineering Services, etc.

Technical Knowledge Required
Strong software abilities in R, Python, Scala,
Experience working with SQL and No-SQL databases,
Data visualisation technologies, and
Cloud infrastructure platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure etc)

Experience Required
Relevant Work-Experience of 5+ years in analytics pre-sales with analytics product OEM, analytics start-up, e-commerce platform
Education: B-Tech,
M-Tech or MBA in IT/Systems preferred
Specialised Course done in Business Analytics

Title: QA Specialist - System Testing
Description:
Job Description
As an Analyst, Quality Assurance at Castus, you will be responsible for supporting our I.T. team to ensure all the projects we develop and deliver meet the highest standards of quality assurance. Working with various stakeholders includes Bug testing, and performance testing to ensure quality deployments, you will be responsible for working closely with the development team to sustain a vision that incorporates QA standards. We are fast growing and lean team so you must be flexible in your testing approach and most importantly, you must have a desire to build a strong team that works well together, delivers quality results. You need to be passionate about testing thus a tester who believes that the best defense is a good offense and is always proactivity looking for ways to make our platforms better.
Successful Candidates Should Have
Lead and coordinate the implementation of the project technical testing strategy and methodology. This includes testing of integration points and interfaces and non-functional requirements (e.g. component response times, data integrity, and security).
Create manual test scripts to enable regression testing.
Develop plans for the technical test phases.
Optimize the use of resources, processes, tools, schedule, and test coverage.
Manage the execution of all technical test phases (including non-functional requirements and integration testing).
Conduct tests on integration points and interfaces and non-functional requirements (component response times, data integrity, and security).
Assist with data planning as it relates to each test phase.
Optimize processes and coordinate the development and verification of test data sets.
Communicate test results regularly through automated reports that summarize test completion and defects found.
Evaluate test results against phase-specific acceptance criteria to determine successful completion of the phase.
Analysis, meeting participation, review of requirements and understanding of the functions/systems that will affect the change. Confirm testability of Test Basis artifacts such as: Business Requirement Documents and Design Documents.
Execute testing as per plan and log defects. Maintain measurements and metrics on quality and effectiveness.
Complete a test summary/closure report and implementation, documenting all testing activities for System Testing for all the projects, programs, and business to ensure successful delivery of services. Successful completion of all testing artifacts, and assurance that; they have been stored in the test management tool.
Document implementation and closure report.


Educational Qualifications Required
Full time or Regular Bachelor’s degree or equivalent or specific relevant experience including BTECH, BE, MTECH, MCA and MSC / MS computer science.
If you think you are the right person, we'd welcome your application!
Please send your CV to hr@castusinfo.com
(3 + yrs of relevant experience - Apply Now)

Title: Specialist App Development
Description:
Lead Developer->> Provides application software development services or technical support in situations of moderate complexity. May also be responsible for requirements gathering and BRD/SRD preparation. Has thorough knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle. Conducts reviews of the test Plan and test Data. Writes new programs of moderate complexity and scope, working with basic application system designs and specifications, utilizing BNY Mellon's standard development methodology, procedures and techniques. Designs and codes programs, and creates test transactions and runs tests to find errors and revise programs. Prepares the final and detailed versions of system modification requirements, ensures turnovers are done on time and correctly. Interfaces with architects to design, code, test and implement application programs. Conducts analysis of organizational needs and goals for the development and implementation of application systems. Proposes innovative, creative technology solutions. Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives. Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, 8+ years of experience in software development required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus, should have thorough knowledge of the software development cycle.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, 8+ years of experience in software development required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus, should have thorough knowledge of the software development cycle.

Title: Business Service Specialist
Description:
Overview:
The MDM Specialist will work alongside a talented team of multi-discipline specialist ; but be able to independently perform routine and non-routine daily activities of Account, Contact, Pricing & Discount life-cycles to ensure a high level of master data integrity worldwide. . The candidate will specifically contribute to system and process improvements to meet the overall corporate goal & objectives. Conduct vertical and basic horizontal business process analyses, whereby judgment is exercised within defined practices and procedures to determine appropriate courses of actions. These accountabilities will be achieved through developing high trust relationships with internal customers, critical data analysis, attention to detail and a customer focus.
The candidate will work in our Bangalore, India Subsidiary to support all European and America countries (and potentially Asia to come).
Responsibilities:
Special Projects
Salesforce Implementation
Assist with the migration of SAP Account Data to Salesforce. The migration is a one-time activity to assist with the data scrubbing between the two systems.

Business Transactions:
Responsible for day-to-day transactions in maintaining all Master Data within ERP & CRM Platforms (SalesForce) and ensuring compliance with Sarbanes Oxley Financial controls. They are as follows:
Account Management:

Maintain the customer database, ensuring all relevant business partner information is recorded, updated or deleted in accordance with procedural guidelines and to ensure data accuracy and minimize duplication of records.
Ensure proper documentation is obtained in order to create, change or delete an account.
Uploading of documents against the business transaction in SAP.
Campaign Management: Directly responsible for processing all requests received via Group inbox and consistent, timely data entry of responses (inquiries or leads).
Global Web Registration Management: Authenticate and process all incoming web records immediately and maintain the integrity of the back-office processes for Waters’ Website Customer Registration Database.
Global Pricing: Maintain the integrity of our product/pricing file within SAP R/3 environment by entry of Transfer & US Base List Pricing for Adds, Changes & Obsoleted Materials for Waters and TA instruments.
Contact Waters: Maintain the data integrity of "Contact Waters" section of Waters.com and ensure immediate responses to our customers and field operations.

eQuotation: Reviewing and Releasing first time New Registration and Quote Request.
Contact Management: Creation, Update and Deletion business partner information in accordance with procedural guidelines to ensure data accuracy and minimize duplication of records.
Releasing of CIT Records so it feeds to the field service organization as a lead.

Working hours / shift is 7 PM to 4 AM India time (supporting US)
Qualifications:
Minimum of an associate degree in Business Administration or 1 to 2 years demonstrated related experience.
Minimum of 1 year working with Salesforce and/or SAP SD/MM Master Data experience.
Experience with a customer database (CRM)
Database experience
Basic product/pricing/customer knowledge
Must possess superior communication & interpersonal skills
Customer Service skills
Working knowledge of system tools (Microsoft Office, SAP, SalesForce, Internet)
Need to keep abreast of new technologies on the horizon.
Participate on projects and/or own project responsibility for non-complex projects where analysis of situations or data requires a review of identifiable factors.
Conduct vertical and basic horizontal business process analyses, whereby judgment is exercised within defined practices and procedures to determine appropriate courses of actions.
Performance Behavior Characteristics
Strong Team worker with the ability to coach and motivate others
Accurate: Places high value
Communication: Good facilitation, verbal communications skills and organizational skills.
Customer satisfaction oriented.
Work in a fast-paced environment and work independently
Analytical: Investigates and sorts information effectively.
Self-starter: Able to work under occasionally stressful situations and be a team player.
Demonstrates professionalism.
Ability to recognize problems and resolve or escalate to proper levels with viable alternate solutions.
Able to follow instructions, take direction and maintain objectivity.
Reliable: Completes work on time
Goal & deadline oriented.
Flexible
The passion to do whatever it takes.

Company Description:
Waters Corporation (NYSE: WAT), the world's leading specialty measurement company, has pioneered chromatography, mass spectrometry and thermal analysis innovations serving the life, materials and food sciences for 60 years. With approximately 7,000 employees worldwide, Waters operates directly in 31 countries, including 15 manufacturing facilities, and with products available in more than 100 countries.

Waters Corporation's businesses include Waters, TA Instruments, VICAM, ERA, and Nonlinear Dynamics.

Waters creates business advantages for laboratory-dependent organizations by delivering ultra performance liquid chromatography (UPLC), high-performance liquid chromatography (HPLC), chromatography columns and chemistry products, mass spectrometry systems, laboratory informatics solutions, and comprehensive service programs to enable significant advancement in healthcare delivery, environmental management, food safety, and water quality.

Diversity and inclusion are fundamental to our core values at Waters Corporation. Celebrating diversity is important to us. We thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products, our customers and our community. Waters is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender identity or protected Veteran status.

Title: Communications Manager
Description:
8! The number of launches planned over the next 2 years.
Your business acumen and communications mastery will help the world understand what these medicines do, why they matter and how Novartis is striving to reimagine medicine.
Purpose of the role is to provide professional advice and support to the business, and coordinate activities/relations for a particular area of the function e.g. media relations within a specific business area. Likely to lead specific programs / campaigns in a country.
Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Coordinate and provide specialist knowledge in one specific area of communications to Group Communications & Act as a strategic partner to the business, and create and support implementation of communications strategies in own area of expertise to support the business.
Supervise the implementation of consistent internal and external communications plans / activities aligned with country organization and Group strategic objectives, implementation of assigned project or communications activity, typically in one location/country.
Build relationships with and counsel senior Business Partners and/or senior Communications colleagues across Group Communications in a specialist field & Manage PR agencies and other external vendors to secure maximum return on investment, operational excellence and business impact.
Use and coordinate available communications resources to achieve required results by ensuring effective deployment of project information/materials & Lead, coach and mentor a small team assigned Communications associates (small team of direct reports) and coordinate education of Communications colleagues and Business Partners across communications specialties.
Change and Transformation Leadership ability to Implement the NTO & Quality Communications plan (internal, social media, traditional media) in the defined region in order to protect and enhance NTO, Quality, and Novartis business and reputation & Develop and lead delivery of individual communications plans, based on global plans, of sites and defined projects.
Develop and coordinate issue and crisis communications plans, in-line with global plans & Manage these efficiently, timely and proactively issue and crisis communications within NTO & Quality for external-related stakeholders in cooperation with relevant functions (Commercial, GDD, Regulatory, Safety, Trial Management).
Consult with executives providing advice on their communications to reflect an understanding of NTO and Novartis priorities and business objectives & Explore opportunities adding value to the organization & Ensure that NTO & Quality Communications strategy is reflected in the country organization and Novartis/Sandoz country communications plan, in order to protect and enhance NTO, Quality, and Novartis’ business and reputation.
Plan, edit and write content for a variety of internal communications mediums, such as Yammer, regular newsletters and info sharing & Develop creative strategies for communicating to employees: plan the frequency of, and vehicles for, communications and coordinate across different sites and functions according to need and requests.

Minimum requirements
University degree in communications, journalism, business administration or the life sciences required. Post-graduate education desirable.
Ability of Operations Management, Project Management and execution & collaborating across boundaries / Cross Cultural Experience.
Ability to manage Agencies & Creative Writing for various Channels developing concise and clear messaging that drives engagement & behavior, channel innovation analysis & synthesis of business information.
Digital & Technology Savvy, Interpersonal Savvy & Being resilient.
Why consider Novartis?
799 million. That’s how many lives our products touched in 2019. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives?

We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.

Imagine what you could do at Novartis!

Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:
Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity and inclusion. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration, and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.
