The Exits team supports employees transitioning out of Amazon, as well as their managers and HRBPs. While responsible for processes such as management and generation of termination documents, final pay, severance agreement generation and execution, reinstatements, and reductions in force, the Exits team collaborates with the broader HR organization to ensure a frustration-free departure as a part of employee's final stage of the lifecycle.

The Exits team is seeking an experienced WFM Sr. Analyst to support the operations team located globally in Costa Rica, Czech Republic, India, and the Philippines. The ideal candidate will possess both an optimization background that enables him/her to manage quantitative planning and a demonstrated ability to think broadly and strategically about customer service initiatives. The Workforce Specialist will experience a wide range of problem solving situations, long term to real-time, requiring extensive data collection and analysis while collaborating closely with the Exits hub leaders.

This person will:
Analyze inputs to predict volume across all Exits programs up to 12 months in the future.
Forecast and plan capacity to staff the Exits appropriate to meet service levels.
Develop, own, and drive Exits key forecasting metrics and reporting initiatives (for example, contacts per unit forecasting and improvements).
Provide daily monitoring and make appropriate adjustments to maximize resource efficiency.
Analyze team performance history to determine optimal production and off production activities, shrinkage and occupancy goals.
Work with the Finance and Operation Management to develop and generate operational targets and participate in the strategic planning effort.
Develop and maintain reporting activities across supported regions.
Evaluate and implement opportunities for improving forecast accuracy and automation of the forecasting process.
Assist in skill blending and profile modification for supported teams.
Collaborate closely with Operations leadership to provide insight and communicate business requirements to the Workforce Management team.
The successful candidate will have: exceptional communication and organizational skills, superior attention to detail, the ability to prioritize in a fast-paced environment, a desire to innovate and continuously learn, strong analytical and critical thinking skills, exceptionally high accuracy, and the customer service focus that the world associates with and expects from Amazon.

MBA preferred.
Knowledge of Six Sigma/Lean Processes.
Capacity Planning experience is strongly preferred.

Title: Senior Test Engineer - Cloud
Description:
About Our Opportunity
AVEVA creates industrial software that inspires people to shape the future. From water and energy to food and infrastructure, our solutions turn opportunities into business value. We work with our customers and harness the power of our ecosystem to deliver solutions across the asset and operations lifecycles. We use collaborative innovation to empower people and industries, enabling the planet to thrive. There are 4,500 of our people in more than 40 countries who challenge themselves and each other to create and improve the transformative technology our customers need. With our help, industries across the world can make a positive difference to the lives of people everywhere. We take pride in our core values and the diversity of our people, valuing the unique experience and expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our business. At AVEVA, we’re all about Limitless possibilities. Are you? Job Purpose Execution of AVEVA Cloud product strategy is one of the key priorities for R&D organization. This is requirement for a System Test and Technical validation expert with extensive experience in the Cloud Technologies (preferably Azure Test specialist) for AVEVA R&D Cross BU System test release roadmap commitments-Common Cloud Platform/Connect. Role of the test team is to design, write and execute functional, integration and performance tests across the range of cloud platform components and services/API. This team member will proactively identify test improvements and enhancements to replicate customer environment. The test team should work in an agile (Scrum) development environment to ensure the smooth transition from development to release delivery. Key Accountabilities • To ensure the delivery of system testing activities (Manual & Test Automation) throughout the duration of a release roadmap for GO-No Go decisions and final system test sign-off. • Guide and Support System Test release roadmap for Common Cloud Platform and ensure Product Owners and Head of development meet quality commitments and goals. • This role demands around 80 % individual contributory (Technical expert/hands on) and 20 % people management efforts for Principle/Architect level profiles. • Assist & improve on the overall test coverage within System Test and mentor the test engineers and senior test engineers from technical/domain perspective. • Able to coordinate with all disciplines of various R&D business units with major focus on cross-product test requirements. • Review the test suite and provide valuable inputs from the technical perspective and act as SME for system test teams. • Performs and monitors daily tests, providing regular status reports as required. Support PI planning events for system test. • Developing and executing the E2E workflow tests according to release requirements. Knowledge, Skills & Experience Required • B.E/B.Tech /M.Tech/M.E in Computer Science discipline from an accredit university or college with professional experience of 5+ years • Experience in Azure/AWS technologies, Microsoft development background/experience. Preferably Azure certified. • Has hands-on experience on Azure DevOps/TFS and related tools. • Has hands-on experience on Engineering software products and has worked at least 4+ years with EPCs or Owner Operators projects/setups or equivalent background. • Proficiency with two or more of the programming languages: Java Script, HTML, Node-Js, C#, .NET, Perl, Python, Angular JS. • Familiar with CI\CD tools such as ADO, git, Jenkins ,Maven, Bamboo. • Good understanding of AWS\Azure micro services architecture and mocking concepts. • Basic Exposure to PaaS technologies and Containers like Docker, Kubernetes. • Ability to derive integration tests and has primarily worked in customer facing or support/technical roles. • Have experience with interface management and data management concepts with Engineering Applications. Understanding and ability to develop end to end workflows from the customer perspective • Ability to replicate customer solution on test environment. • Understanding and ability to develop tests, run tests, find defects and log defects effectively and collaborate with development teams. • Understanding of Functional Test methods/Test automation (SDET skills) and different phases of testing: systems integration, systems testing & user acceptance testing AVEVA is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we take pride in the diversity of our employees, valuing the special experience and expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our business. The ability to develop ground-breaking technologies is one of our key assets and our people make it happen. Come and join AVEVA to create the transformative technology that enables our customers to engineer a better world.

Title: Senior Malware Researcher
Description:
Company Description

FireEye is the intelligence-led security company. Working as a seamless, scalable extension of customer security operations, FireEye offers a single platform that blends innovative security technologies, nation-state grade threat intelligence, and world-renowned Mandiant® consulting. With this approach, FireEye eliminates the complexity and burden of cyber security for organizations struggling to prepare for, prevent, and respond to cyber attacks. FireEye has over 9,000 customers across 103 countries, including more than 50 percent of the Forbes Global 2000.

Job Description
We are seeking seasoned malware and security savvy candidates to augment our team and contribute in the malware investigation, detection, classification, validation, and release activities in support of our leading edge advanced malware detection solutions.

What You Will Do:
Handle customer detection issues, provide prompt and accurate feedback to customers
Research, diagnose, troubleshoot and identify solutions to resolve customer issues
Follow standard procedures for proper escalation of unresolved issues to the appropriate internal teams
Ensure proper recording and closure of all issues
Prepare accurate and timely reports
Discover, track and analyze latest malware, network and email cyber threats
Document knowledge in the form of knowledge base tech notes and articles

Qualifications
At least 5+ years direct or equivalent experience in the areas of network, email security/malware analysis
Knowledge in computer and IT security.
Knowledge in cyber threats and vulnerabilities.
Knowledge in network traffic analysis tools such as Wireshark and tcpdump
Specialist in programming with Python
Candidate should have good communication skills to respond to the support/customer queries.
Additional Qualifications:
Preferred: Hands-on reverse engineering
Strong problem solving, troubleshooting and analysis skills
Experience working in fast-paced development environments
Excellent inter-personal and teamwork skills
Self-driven, proactive, hardworking, team-player with a good sense of humor
Preferred: Experience in big data infrastructure is a definite plus
BS/MS in computer science or equivalent experience
Above all, the right passion and attitude to solve new challenges

Additional Information

You will have the opportunity to work with the industry most advanced technologies

Title: AWS Data Lab Solution Architect
Description:
Highly technical and analytical, possessing 3 or more years of Database and/or Analytics Systems development and deployment experience, IT systems and engineering experience, security and compliance experience, etc.
Possess significant experience of software development and/or IT and implementation/consulting experience.
Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations and virtual teams.
Ability to think understand complex business requirements and render them as prototype systems with quick turnaround time.
Implementation and tuning experience in the Big Data Ecosystem, (such as EMR, Hadoop, Spark, R, Presto, Hive), Database (such as Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, MS SQL Server), NoSQL (such as DynamoDB, HBase, MongoDB, Cassandra, design principles) and Data Warehousing (such as Redshift, Teradata, Vertica, schema design, query tuning and optimization) and data migration and integration.
Track record of implementing AWS services in a variety of business environments such as large enterprises and start-ups.
Knowledge of foundation infrastructure requirements such as Networking, Storage, and Hardware Optimization.
BS level technical degree required; Computer Science or Mathematics background preferred. [DB1]
AWS Certification, eg. AWS Solutions Architect, Developer, or AWS Certified Big Data - Specialty

Are you a data and analytics specialist? Do you have deep expertise in AWS services for managing data at speed and scale? Do you think big about how data can change the world, and love building software? Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help customers and partners use cloud computing services to build new solutions, faster, and at lower cost?

At AWS, we’re hiring highly technical cloud computing architects and engineers to collaborate with our customers on building solutions in database, data management, and analytics. AWS Data Lab is located in Seattle, New York, Herndon, London, and now Bangalore. You will focus on real time and batch-based data processing, business intelligence, analytics, and machine learning systems. These solutions are built alongside the customer and quickly put into production use in a matter of weeks. You'll work closely with AWS Field Teams including Solution Architects, Technical Account Managers, and AWS Service Developers to partner with customers to solve hard problems with data. Every day, you'll be working with AWS Services and Data Lab Customers to determine the optimal implementation, build it, prove it works, extract documents and CloudFormation templates to speed project delivery. If you are builder, and love data, then this could be your ideal job!

Roles & Responsibilities
Understand customer requirements and render those as architectural models that will operate at large scale and high performance. Where customers have architectures prepared, validate them against non-functional requirements and finalize the build model.
Work alongside customers to build data management platforms using Elastic Map Reduce (EMR), Redshift, Kinesis, Amazon Machine Learning, Amazon Athena, Lake Formation, S3, AWS Glue, DynamoDB, ElastiCache and the Relational Database Service (RDS)
Render working, high performance data management solutions, as CloudFormation and reusable artifacts for implementation by the customer
Prepare architecture and design briefs that outline the key features and decision points of the application built in the Data Lab
Work with customers to advise on changes as they put these systems live on AWS
Extract best-practice knowledge, reference architectures, and patterns from these engagements for sharing with the worldwide AWS solution architect community

Hands on experience leading large-scale global database, data warehousing and analytics projects.
Demonstrated industry leadership in the fields of Database and/or Data Warehousing, Data Sciences and Big Data processing.
Deep understanding of data, application, server, and network security
Experience with Statistics, Machine Learning and Predictive Modelling.
Hands on experience as a database, data warehouse, big data/analytics developer or administrator, or work as a data scientist.
Experience working within the software development or Internet industries is highly desired.
Technical degrees in computer science, software engineering, or mathematics
Working knowledge of modern software development practices and technologies such as agile methodologies and DevOps.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Title: TECHNICAL CONSULTING ENGINEER - Cloud TAC
Description:
What You’ll Do
Support Cloud and Hybrid Products: Cisco WebEx, Jabber IM (Cloud), CMR , WebEx Teams Services (Call, Message, Meet), hybrid services and along with phone and conferencing endpoints connected to the cloud.
Provide highest-level technical support to help resolve sophisticated customer problems from on-prem to Cisco Cloud.
Engage with the Engineering Business Unit to influence the quality and serviceability of products.
Innovate – Identify and work with BU to improve tools, script automation, or other activities that will enable the TAC engineer to work more efficiently and speed accelerate issue identification and resolution.
Incident Leadership - Coordinate or execute processes as needed for internal/external comms and management updates during production incidents/outages/maintenances.
Request, process, write and manage the delivery of RFO/RCA summary statements from Cloud Engineering.
Communicate and work effectively with staff at all levels of the organization and cross-functionally
Provide regular status to other service and delivery leaders on trends, issues, opportunities, and issues, and deliver constructive feedback both face to face and in writing. Minimum Qualifications:
CCNP, CCIE Collaboration preferred.
Minimum of 3 years of experience supporting SaaS solutions, enterprise applications, solutions and/or collaboration infrastructures is required. “Real-time” service support environment experience is helpful.

Skilled understanding of:
Networking – Routing Switching (TCP/QoS)
Microsoft Solutions (Exchange, Active Directory, LDAP)
Microsoft (IIS, SQL), VMWare, Linux, SSL Certs
Strong demonstrable understanding and support experience of Microsoft Office, Windows, Mac OS, iOS, Android OS.
CUCM
Telepresence (VCS Expressway, VCS controller, TMS, Conferencing, TPS)
Protocols (SIP, RTP, DTMF, SAML, SMTP), Web Proxy and Web API experience would be required.
Ability to provide leadership across the entire collaboration solution to lead a technical team to find and resolve customer issues
Lead by example, mentor, and train others
Technically astute, willing and able to pick up technology and concepts and develop training and content
Effective listening and good interpersonal skills (both verbal and written)
Ability to work with Engineering architects to influence serviceability and usability design
Comfortable in a fast-paced, self-guided, multifaceted and fast paced environment Who You’ll Work With
Strategically positioned within the Cisco Services Organization, Cisco's Technical Assistance Centre (TAC) is a team of outstanding technical specialists whose main focus is to help customers deploy and operate their networks efficient while delivering the best possible customer experience. Aligned to three geographic regions, and converging into one global, borderless TAC, we are the first to be confronted by challenges and issues with new equipment and tools in the field.
The Cloud Collaboration TAC team provides second/third level technical support for Cloud / Hybrid solutions and cloud-enabled endpoint products on a worldwide basis via inbound/outbound phone calls, email, web and remote access. We provide diligent support to our customers, partners, account teams, and other TAC engineers. With a technology runway that never ends, opportunities to develop your depth, breadth and diversity of technical expertise are the best! Who You Are
Graduates in Computer Engineering; Computer Programming; Information Technology; Management Information Systems & Computer Science, with high academic score at graduate level.
At least 3 – 5 years’ experience in support of Cisco Unified Communications or Business Video Solutions.
Troubleshooting experience and knowledge of VOIP/Video signalling
Understanding of WebEx - Cloud application services, or Software as a Service (SaaS).
CCNA
Good understanding of call control protocols
Hands On Experience - Log Analysis (SIP/PRT/Wireshark/Http log/Fiddler)
Fluent in English, written and verbal.
Strong customer focus and willing to help peer and customer with an attitude provide solutions Why Cisco
We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking results-oriented risks to craft the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with outstanding personalities who aren’t afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns.
We are leaders with vision, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers.
We Are Cisco.

Title: Marketing Manager
Description:
We are looking to hire a Marketing Manager responsible for managing the company’s marketing initiatives and building awareness about how our products/services can satisfy the market needs. As a successful hire, he or she will be responsible for initiating and supporting lead generation efforts, working out online and offline marketing campaigns and managing a lead generation team while managing and inspiring the team. He/she will be comfortable with day-to-day marketing activities, as well as long-term strategy, thriving with tight deadlines and changing needs. If you are a people-person who loves the rewarding challenge of building a brand, we want to hear from you.
Key Responsibilities
– Supporting sales and lead generation efforts.
– Works with marketing staff to develop detailed marketing plans for lead generation and online campaigns.
– Creating promotions, identifying, and organizing for participation in trade shows, conferences.
– Establishes marketing goals based on past performance and market forecasts is essential. Understanding, developing & communicating Marketing plans, including expenditures, research and development appropriations, return-on-investment etc.
– Researching demand for the organization’s products and services.
– Maintaining websites, conducting data analytics, updating databases in CRM etc.
– Directing, planning, and coordinating online marketing efforts on campaigns, Social Media, advertisements etc.
– Evaluating competitors.
– Track all marketing plans and Communicate with senior management about marketing initiatives and project metrics, as well as to brainstorm fresh strategies.
– Able to adopt to ongoing situations, porting and focusing activities with respect to evolving scenarios with emphasis on online marketing in short term.
– Assess the requirements from OEMs and increase the marketing contributed revenue share.
– Mobilize and manage e-mail, content marketing, creative communication and web design to test and evolve lead nurturing tactics.
Qualification:
– Preferably 6+ years of relevant experience
– Should be a graduate with marketing specialization or equivalent
– Highly self-motivated with ability to work on own initiative as well as part of a larger team.
– Strong verbal and written communication skills; fluent in English
– Proficiency with online marketing and social media strategy
– Established press and media contacts will be added advantage
– Metrics-driven marketing mind with eye for creativity
– Must be able to travel extensively, including overnight and international travels
– Experience with marketing automation and CRM tools is mandatory with web analytics software and keyword tools will be added advantage

Experience required : 6+ years
CTC: As per the standard
About Altem: Altem Technologies Pvt. Ltd, awarded one among “Top 100” companies in India by SME India Forum, is an engineering firm with core strengths in Product Life Cycle Management, Advanced and Additive Manufacturing (AM) Solutions and 3D Digitization Technologies. ALTEM is head-quartered in Bangalore, India and operates through the sales offices in Chennai, Hyderabad, Pune, Kolkata, Mumbai, Chandigarh, and New Delhi. The Altem team consists of consultants, application engineers, designers, domain experts and software specialists.
Altem today is serving more than 250 loyal customers from leading Indian and Global companies across diverse segments such as life sciences, aeronautics, defence, electronics, medical, manufacturing, space research and academia in India in association with Dassault Systemes for PLM solution, Stratasys for Additive Manufacturing solution, Artec3D for Digitization solution and MSC Software (part of Hexagon) for CAE solution. Altem Technologies has in the past been recognized for its work with accolades like the India’s Small Giants award, SME 100 Award, Dassault Systèmes Growth Award and Stratasys Strategic Vision Partner award, Top Customer Advocacy Business Award and Best Growth Award speaks volumes of the spot Altem Technologies has attained in the industry over the years. Altem today is Dassault Systèmes ‘Value Solutions Platinum Partner’ in India. Altem is also the recipient of Frost & Sullivan’s 3D Printers Technology Innovation award for showing exemplary growth, innovation, and performance in the field of 3D Printing in India.

Title: IT Global Service Desk Technician
Description:
The Company:
SHL helps companies optimize performance and productivity through deep people insights. Our market-leading people analytics and technology equip leaders and their teams to make confident, data-driven talent decisions that lead to stronger business outcomes.
We anticipate, and help organizations solve, their most pressing talent challenges. Our science, innovation, rigor and commitment to proving business outcomes make us a trusted partner to organizations across the globe. SHL helps our customers win, and we need highly motivated people to join our dynamic global team. We’re driven by Strong Connections, Curiosity, Fearless Innovation, and Impact. More at shl.com.
The Role:
Job Title: Service Desk Technician
Location(s): Gurgaon
Do you enjoy fixing people’s IT problems? Do you excel in rapidly understanding issues and finding resolutions to those issues? SHL is seeking a Service Desk Technician to join our Global Service Desk team based in Gurgaon. This team supports the SHL business around the clock across the world from its’ IT Centre in Gurgaon. As a Service Desk Technician, you will be at the forefront of keeping your colleagues across SHL productive by ensuring that any issues with their hardware or software are promptly addressed.
SHL fosters a collaborative and supportive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have opportunities to grow their professional careers by working with experienced IT managers and professionals. The ideal candidate will possess a demonstrable track record of success academically and working in an IT environment.
As a Service Desk Technician, you will provide both essential advice and support to colleagues across the world when they are challenged by the IT that they use each day at work. IT is essential that you are a strong communicator, a good listener and have sound technical skills to enable you to resolve the wide variety of issues that are faced by the Service Desk. Key to success is having the ability to work hands on with a desire to find workable solutions to user problems.
Key Accountabilities:
Our Global Service Desk provides both in-person and phone-based support to SHL employees across the globe. This is an outstanding position for candidates who have excellent technical and client service skills and enjoy managing a wide-variety of responsibilities while working in a fast-paced and friendly global environment.
The Global Service Desk provide technical support for desktop hardware and software by identifying issue(s), determining and executing appropriate resolution, and communicating the resolution to the customer.
Examples include:
Troubleshoot and provide resolution upon initial contact when possible, using remote management tools
Escalate or re-assign tickets to other departments when required
Maintain accurate up-to-date status on all tickets
Ensure no tickets are older than 3 days in personal queue
Provide walk up/local IT support for hardware and software issues
Assist with mobile device issues
Perform new user/new hire equipment set up
Perform basic hardware and workstation repairs
Develop and maintain technical documentation for desktop hardware and software applications
Meet or exceed all Global Service Desk metrics and process requirements (ticket management protocols, time tracking, communication requirements, etc.)
Ensure that all users have been properly communicated before closing a ticket request
Treat all colleagues with courtesy and professionalism
Serve as point of contact for management
Required Skills & Experience:
At least 1 years’ experience working on an IT Help Desk strongly preferred
Knowledge of/experience with the following:
Windows 10
Office 365
Outlook
SharePoint
Chrome/IE/Firefox
Mac device support
iPhone support
Passion for providing excellent customer service
Strong English written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work in a fast-pace environment; ability to multi-task, change direction, effectively prioritize, and meet deadlines
Ability to work on shift patterns that provide round the clock support to the business
Ability to occasionally adjust work schedule to meet business need
Interest in being part of a team, and ability to work effectively with both local and remote staff, teammates and managers
Our Ideal Candidate Also Has:
ITIL Foundation Certification
Undergraduate degree preferred
Able to lift, carry and bend as required to install common end user computing items including desktop PCs and monitors, desktop telephones, desktop printers, and power protection devices.
What SHL Can Offer You:
A culture comprised of diverse, global teams who have a passion for collaboration and client service
A comprehensive benefit packages
Support, coaching, and on-the-job development to achieve career success
The ability to engage, influence, and interact with a broad array of IT managers and specialists

Title: Workday Software Development Engineer II (Advanced Compensat...
Description:
The Expedia Peoples Technology Team is looking for a Software Development Engineer II with a focus on Workday SaaS ERP to support the Expedia Group Brands. As a Senrior Engineer, your main responsibility will be defining and implementing Workday Business Processes, Configurations, Integrations and 3rd party tools with a deep focus on Compensation and year end Compensation processes. You will be part an integral part of a team dedicated to constantly improving the configuration and optimization of Workday to meet Expedia’s global requirement.
This position combines expert-level proficiency in multiple Workday modules with the ability to communicate clearly and collaborate with Technical Product Managers, Total rewards & compensation teams, turning broad requirements into deliverable work items. The individual will also work with multi-functional teams to address system, interface, data and vendor issues. Finally, the role will be primarily responsible for bidirectional integration of Workday with and comp related external tools.
Who you are-You'll fit if you have:
Proven experience, 7+ yin HCM implementation in one or more ERP systems.
Have deep domain knowledge of Workday Compensation Module and Year End Compensation Processes within Workday.
Identify, design, test, implement, execute and maintain system configuration for Workday Compensation.
Must have Advanced Compensation implementation experience into Workday.
Be a specialist in the design, implementation and measurement of compensation and benefits programs and policies that support Expedia Group’s compensation strategy
Lead implementation & roll out of multiple compensation programs and processes which include the annual compensation planning cycle, equity grants, off cycles
Experience with writing Compensation related reports and dashboards is a must.
Workday/Workday Pro HCM or Advanced Compensation certification preferred but not required.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Bachelors or Master’s degree in information science, computer science, business or equivalent work experience.
Understanding of Agile project methodologies, including Scrum and Kanban, required.
What you will do:
Participate in the design, analysis, development and deployment efforts for multiple application projects to tackle sophisticated global recruiting & talent problems and improvements.
Design, document, configure, and implement changes in Workday Compensation and Advanced Compensation modules.
Collaborating with Developers, Product managers, Technical Product managers and Production Support Engineers to implement technical requirements.
Crafting runbooks for troubleshooting, recovery, and routine maintenance of in house developed systems.
Collaborate with 3rd party companies that support native and custom Workday Integrations.
Why join us:
Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, hardworking, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better – that responsibility encourages us to be the place where outstanding people want to do their best work, and to provide them the tools to do so.
Whether you're applying to work in engineering or customer support, marketing or lodging supply, at Expedia Group we act as one team, working towards a common goal; to bring the world within reach. We relentlessly strive for better, but not at the cost of the customer. We act with humility and optimism, respecting ideas big and small. We value diversity and voices of all volumes. We are a global organization but keep our feet on the ground, so we can act fast and stay simple. Our teams also have the chance to give back on a local level and make a difference through our corporate social responsibility program, Expedia Cares.
If you have a hunger to make a difference with one of the most loved consumer brands in the world and to work in the dynamic travel industry, this is the job for you.
Our family of travel brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Egencia®, trivago®, HomeAway®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Wotif®, lastminute.com.au®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Hotwire®, Classic Vacations®, Expedia® Media Solutions, CarRentals.com™, Expedia Local Expert®, Expedia® CruiseShipCenters®, SilverRail Technologies, Inc., ALICE and Traveldoo®.
Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability or age.

Title: ServiceNow Developer
Description:
Job Responsibilities:
Develop and customize ServiceNow – providing effort estimates, collecting requirements, design & development, testing, writing implementation plans, and execution
Support the development and configuration of a variety of areas including, but not limited to Incident, Service Catalog, Change, Problem, Knowledge, Release / SDLC, Asset Management, Configuration Management (CMDB), Project, Time Cards, CMS, and Reporting.
Building of Custom Application as per Client requirement
Ensure technical designs meet functional design requirements as well as maintain the integrity and sustainability of the application.
Define and meet standards for implementations in ServiceNow to ensure consistency and supportability of customizations.
Develop test cases for functional and regression testing.
Follow Change Management and Problem Management processes regarding the automation of ServiceNow.
Develop and test ServiceNow Customizations including, but not limited to: screen tailoring, workflow administration, report setup, data imports, LDAP integration, custom scripting and third party software integrations.
Perform Unit Testing, System Integration Testing and Support client in User Acceptance Testing
Analyze ServiceNow and ServiceNow data for potential issues and provide support for resolution of issues.
Analyze, troubleshoot, and remedy identified system issues.
Recommend corrections to enhance system and application performance.
Delivery of ServiceNow based technical solutions in support of Service Management project objectives.
Lead efforts to implement ServiceNow technical solutions necessary to automate processes and support the operation of end-to-end IT services and IT processes.
Assist in the data collection for organizational metrics
Participate in requirements gathering, design and implementation of service management capabilities
Research organizational performance through the ServiceNow platform
Executes according to project schedule and manages timeline and communication during implementation
Translate business and functional requirements into ServiceNow system configuration requirements
Regularly communicates with project stakeholders and provides opportunities for their input as it relates to assigned deliverables
Deployment of ServiceNow system within Project timeline period.

Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Information Systems, Management Information Systems, Computer Science or other related field or higher (preferred)
ServiceNow System Administrator Certification
ServiceNow Implementation Specialist Certification (preferred)
ITIL V3 Foundation Certification (preferred)
Excellent interpersonal, verbal/written communication skills and ability adapt to varied audiences
Minimum of 3 years demonstrated experience administering and programming ServiceNow in a large enterprise environment
Minimum of 3 years demonstrated experience using Web Technologies (JAVAScript, XML, HTML, AJAX, CSS, HTTP).
Must have solid programming skills
Experience with Jelly scripting in ServiceNow
Working knowledge of web applications, networks, protocols and email (SMTP, POP3)
Experience on Integration technologies such as Web Services, SOAP, HTTP, MID Server
Experience with relational databases such as MS SQL Server, Oracle.
Experience with IT Service Management processes and SDLC

Title: IT Technical Engineer - Senior Salesforce Developer
Description:
About Nokia
At Nokia we create the technology to connect the world. Developing and delivering the industry's only end-to-end portfolio of network equipment, software, services and licensing that is available globally. Through our research teams, including the world-renowned Nokia Bell Labs, Nokia is leading the world to adopt end-to-end 5G networks that are faster, more secure and capable of revolutionizing lives, economies and societies. Nokia adheres to the highest ethical business standards as we create technology with social purpose, quality and integrity. A truly global company, we are 160 nationalities working in more than 100 countries.

Job Description

Nokia is a global leader in the technologies that connect people and things. With state-of-the-art software, hardware and services for any type of network, Nokia is uniquely positioned to help communication service providers, governments, and large enterprises deliver on the promise of 5G, the Cloud and the Internet of Things. Serving customers in over 100 countries, our research scientists and engineers continue to invent and accelerate new technologies that will increasingly transform the way people and things communicate and connect.
Nokia is a key supplier to help operators on their transformation journey to Telco Cloud business. To drive Nokia’s and our Customers success Nokia requires highly effective internal IT capabilities across Marketing, Sales, Pre-Sales / Tendering and Post-Sales Service customer engagement, digitally and face to face.
The Design and Realization of such Capabilities will be executed in Nokia’s global “IT Business Applications” department. The “Commercial IT” team there is seeking innovative and passionate Solution and Technical specialists who share our vision of bringing excellence in all of Nokia’s Digital Customer interactions with specific focus on CPQ (Configure-Price-Quote) transformation.
Your ability to bring your vision and concepts to life will not only be welcomed but celebrated. You will be creating high quality, interactive prototypes that will be seen and used daily by thousands. You will be working with a highly driven team that has delivered countless successful solutions to external and internal customer teams around the world.
We are seeking innovative and passionate Solution and Technical specialists, who share our vision of bringing the power of cloud computing to enterprises and are willing to work in cooperation with business representatives, process owners, stakeholders managers and IT partners to pro-actively understand and capture business functions’ needs and translate them into IT requirements.
If you're passionate about innovation, come help us to revolutionize how Nokia collaborates and communicates with our customers. The Commercial IT team will be responsible for successfully creating enterprise Digital Customer experiences using Salesforce.com, Apttus and AppExchange application solutions and services and integrating Salesforce.com with other enterprise systems and AppExchange partners. Ideally, you have knowledge of CRM and CPQ processes and solutions and hold certifications of Salesforce.com and Apttus CPQ.
Job Role purpose
Technical software expert, executing software development including research, design, programming, and testing of operating or new software. Supporting business and IT to adapt digital technologies faster and to improve application or solution performance.
Job Responsibilities & Competencies
Analyses technical requirements and translates them into implementable SW designs and configurations. Evaluates possibilities with different technologies and platforms
Analyses ideas and demands for technology and architectural fit and provides technical estimates that can be used by program owner for cost / benefit analysis. Codes, develops, builds, modifies, configures and proposes detailed technical solutions utilizing existing or new technologies
Follows agile and/or PM practices
Aligns the implemented solution that it is in line with the solution design
Provides production support right after go-live
Analyses and studies complex systems requirements and troubleshoots and resolves issues in existing software or solution
Prepares software design, configuration and technical implementation documentation
Participates in prototyping, pilots and PoC’s
Takes care of solution integration and provisioning
Designs and implements system security
Connects and automates data sources, along with building visualizations
Proactively follows the digital market technologies and trends and innovations
Provides technical guidance for projects or solution designs
Develops, builds and deploys solution configurations based on tool knowledge and deep technical and software programming and coding skills
Tests software and is responsible for the quality of software development and deployment. Performs automated and manual tests to ensure the software created by developers is fit for purpose. Handles test planning, risk mitigation and prevention of software issues
At least 3 years experience using CRM, Pre-Sales, Sales and Service Applications. (Specifically, SaaS based)
Familiar with cloud architecture
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or engineering degree in Telecommunications/Information Technology/Computer Science or equivalent
4-6 years’ experience in a comparable role
Admin Salesforce.com and Apttus CPQ Product Certifications
Scrum Master Certification
Experience in working with Agile methodology
Ability to drive, strong influencing skills and lead without formal power and line authority
Sound methodical skills with attention to detail and process requirements
Capability to multi-task and prioritize to ensure timely deliveries
Comfortable with working with multiple stakeholders in a multi-cultural environment of a global matrix organization with sensitivity and partnering
Excellent presentation, networking and communication skills
Problem Solving
High energy, initiative, enthusiasm and persistence
Fluent written & spoken English
4-5 years experience in Salesforce platform
Experience with Test Automation
Imagine creating technology that has the potential to change the world. Working with us, you will have a positive impact on people’s lives and help to overcome some of the world’s most pressing challenges. We act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Nokia culture welcomes people as their true selves. Come create the technology to connect the world.

Title: Cloud Intelligence - Business Development Specialist
Description:
15+ years of solid experience in pre-sales, cloud, technology services and/or products with a leading technology services/products/consulting organisation
Deep understanding of business and technical aspects of cloud computing with Technical Certification on public cloud platforms
Clear track record of managing complex projects and programs while demonstrating exceptional business judgement
Experience of working with variety of India customers across Enterprises, Startups, SMB etc.
Proven ability to work with business segment leaders, technical leaders with ability to influence road maps

Are you comfortable in conducting assessment of product features in detail and contextualising this to drive enhanced customer outcomes? Can you take complex scenarios and simplify them down to the essentials, crafting an elegant approach that drives customer adoption and revenue growth?

Amazon Internet Services Pvt Ltd (AISPL) is looking for a Cloud Intelligence BD Specialist for its Cloud Intelligence function in India. You will have the exciting opportunity to help and assist in deliver on a strategy for using competitive intelligence and specifically technical insights to programmatically scale AWS’s cloud computing business. Your responsibilities will include supporting the AISPL’s India Cloud Intelligence lead, and field teams on customer and partner engagements to win competitive deals. You will serve as an expert resource on competitive intelligence of cloud, IT applications and infrastructures, working with our customers and field teams in India, helping them understand the benefits of migrating to AWS, articulate technical differentiators of AWS versus competition while contextualising the business impact for the customer.

You will synthesise data and information as it relates to functional comparison and key differentiators from intelligence gathering and customer engagements into succinct findings and persuasively communicate findings and perspectives to India Cloud Intelligence lead and eventually to business development (BD) and Service teams in India. The ideal candidate will possess a business and technical background that enables them to drive engagements and communicate the benefits of AWS to IT architects, engineering teams and C-Level executives to ensure better CX and compliance with global AWS standards, practices and policies. You should have demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term about the complex business and technical needs of customers. You should also have detailed knowledge and a strong technical understanding of cloud concepts and vendors in general, and AWS specifically.

Roles & Responsibilities

Serve as a key member of the India Cloud Intelligence team in helping to drive AISPL engagements with our customers and partners
Work closely with the India Cloud Intelligence lead and field teams to drive closure on our highest priority opportunities in the pipeline
Understand the business and technical requirements of our customers and partners and determine how their needs can best be met by AISPL.
Address customer questions or concerns about feature and functional comparison of AWS, as compared to other vendors in the market
Serve as a central resource for the BD team to help proactively educate our customers on the benefits of AWS cloud platform
Create a repository of Cloud Intelligence cases studies and best practice collaterals to share learnings with all parts of AWS
Serve as a key source of market insights into how our customers view the benefits of using AWS relative to the broader Cloud Computing market
Handle a high volume of engagements and fast pace of the cloud computing market
Actively track market trends with respect to cloud computing and the broader IT market in India in general (technologies, key providers & their offerings/use cases/strengths & weaknesses/programs, commercials, market size & opportunity)

MBA, Computer Science, and/or Engineering background highly desirable
Deep understanding of Public Cloud Platforms i.e. Microsoft, Google, Oracle Cloud platforms
Technical certifications (Public Cloud Platforms)
10+ years of customer-facing roles
Experience developing content and solution selling to scale across hundreds of sales reps and/or partners
Demonstrable ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audience
Demonstrable strong customer focus, ownership, urgency and drive

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Title: Petroleum Scientist
Description:

A change agent, manages overall projects and teams, to generate target revenue and profitability by successfully meeting customer objectives

Title: Technical Specialist - Office 365
Description:
Datavail provides a broad range of services in support of databases, analytics, and applications and specializes in Oracle, Oracle E-Business Suite, OBIEE and OBIA, Hyperion, Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, MongoDB, DB2 and SharePoint. Datavail is a leading provider of data integration and database administration services in North America, offering 24×7 managed database, applications, and BI/DW services, design, architecture, and consulting. With more than 850 employees on payroll and core operations in four countries, Datavail offers deep technical expertise in a flexible, agile engagement model that focuses on customer success. Founded in 2007, Datavail is based in Broomfield, Colorado and supports enterprise clients located worldwide. As part of the Datavail team, you’ll have the opportunity to work on exciting projects with a mandate to innovate, create, and deploy some of the best technology solutions in the world. The opportunity to work alongside our broad team of experts to learn, grow and build your career can only be found in one place – Datavail. Working at Datavail is not just a career, but an opportunity to be a part of something bigger. Come grow with us! For more information, visit www.datavail.com
Datavail is looking for an Office 365 Technical Specialist with hands-on experience and technical knowledge of Office 365 to operate, implement, administer, and troubleshoot Microsoft Windows software’s and applications and services both on-premises and within Office 365, This includes but is not limited to performing routine audits of the system and applying updates, patches, and configuration changes as required. The candidate will also identify and resolve performance or security issues through the analysis of computer logs, scan results, and other tools provided by the government. The candidates will help resolve issues with Office 365, Microsoft SharePoint and Microsoft Teams. In doing so, they will use multiple tools provided by the company, including the Office 365 Connection Evaluation (OCE) tool Microsoft has provided to check client configuration and connectivity to Office 365.
Position: Technical Specialist
Experience: 10+ Years
Education: BE / BTech / ME / MTech
Location: Bangalore / Hyderabad / Mumbai
Qualifications: Should be well versed with the O365 Admin and specialist in SharePoint admin and Development both the areas
Skills: O365, SharePoint, SharePoint Development, Project Management, CRM and .Net is a plus
Responsibilities:
Setup Office 365 accounts for users
Setup distribution lists and TEAM channels in Office 365
Migration, setup and support from SharePoint On-premise and SharePoint Online
Solution development for core user journeys that require Office and Email and other MS365 products
Setup Office 365 SharePoint sites for domain users
Troubleshoot and resolve issues with user access to Office 365 services
Administer and support Office 365 Azure
Maintain a highly secure Office 365 system through proper configuration and system access monitoring
Assist with the creation of policies around the proper use of Office 365 services
Working is shifts, guiding admins from other companies on best practices, setups and solutioning of the SharePoint and other O365 software’s.
Requirements:
Microsoft 365 Certified: Enterprise Administrator Expert preferred
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, or related and a minimum of 3 years of direct experience
Deep understanding of Microsoft 365 technologies and architecture including, Office ProPlus, Exchange Online, OneDrive,
SharePoint Online MS Teams
Add on knowledge on Migration support from Exchange On-premise to Exchange Online
· Must have real-world experience in OneDrive, SharePoint and MS Teams deployments strongly desired
Minimum 10+ years Productivity Tools Engineering experience
Experience in agile and working in an agile environment will be a strong plus
Demonstrated ability to configure Azure Active Directory and Hybrid Active Directory
Experience installing and the configuration of Remote Desktop Services
Knowledge of and ability to define and resolve Microsoft licensing requirements.
Experience configuring standard software installations for customer laptops in O365
Experience configuring Intune and EMS
Ability to problem-solve and use analytical abilities
Strong oral and written communication skills are required
Strong customer service and interpersonal skills
Desired Skills:
· Office 365 development experience and experience with Azure is highly preferred
· SharePoint Framework knowledge and shell scripting

Title: Middleware Administrator
Description:
Introduction
We build phenomenal products that our customers rely on so it’s important they are running at their best. As a Systems Management Specialist, you will work with the latest software to keep moving business forward. Whether it’s our Engineering teams that need a test environment or our software running in production, we are seeking skilled systems management professionals ready for the challenge.

Your Role and Responsibilities
IBM's Purpose is to be essential to our clients, to the world and one another and we are confident that together as IBMers we will drive this purpose. When you join IBM you join a culture of openness, teamwork, trust, and the invitation and expectation to have a voice. Join us and Do your Best Work Ever.
We are recognized gold standard for inclusion, reflected in winning, to name a few, the 2018 Catalyst Award for advancing women in business, the National Award 'Best Employer of People with Disabilities' and being named one of the top 5 2018 Top Companies for Women Technologists for building an inclusive work environment — We advocate for fairness and equality as everyone is, and always has been, welcome at IBM.
Join a brand with a history of continuous re-invention, transforming itself throughout its 100-plus years. In its current transformation, IBM is once again leading the reordering of the technology industry.

Title: Sr Advanced Data Engineer
Description:
Deliver business value through Right and Fast partnership
JOB TITLE : Sr. Advanced Data Engineer
Description/Brief Summary of what role entails (Job Purpose)
Sr. Advanced Data Engineer is responsible for the data infrastructure and architecture. Sr. Advanced Data Engineer works as individual contributor, facilitates solution architecture design, leverage data and business principles to automate data flow, detect business exceptions, build diagnostic capabilities, improve both business and data knowledge base. Act as a mentor to other team members.
This role requires hands-on experience in working with Big Data infrastructure. Drive the design, building, and launching of new data models and data pipelines in production.
Sr. Advanced Data Engineer is expected to closely work with ISC Global Analytics team members as well with Enterprise IT team to align practices and priorities to support the transition of analytics to FORGE – Big Data platform.

Key Tasks and Responsibilities
• Connect with the business users and identify opportunities to drive business value via analytics solutions. • As a Bigdata Architect, Sr Advanced Data Engineer will handle designing of solutions required to automate administration, data capture, processing, data modelling processes to meet business's Analytics needs. • The Architect is responsible for big data storage, processing and analytics use cases development and design analytics models with NFR (Performance, Availability, Scalability, And Integrity). The resulting design may run on multiple platforms and composed of multiple software packages & custom components. • This role defines best practices in the critical evaluation and selection and /or development of the software components and hardware requirements of the applications and data, and the development of the application, including evaluation and selection of development methods, development processes, best practices and tools. • Drive continuous improvement and innovation. - Work with cross functional teams effectively • Coach and mentor Data Engineers / Specialists, leading by example through acting as an individual contributor • Work with Honeywell businesses and Enterprise IT teams to clearly outline how enterprise platforms can enable business growth & productivity by seamlessly combining structured and unstructured data into a single, self-service analytical environment. • Leverage knowhow and domain knowledge of Honeywell experts to define, design and develop intelligent solutions to operate on large data sets related to Supply Chain.
Qualifications:
• Bachelors in Engineering / Technology degree or equivalent • Specialized in Computer Science, Software Engineering / Information Technology or related field • Certifications in Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate (MCSA) / Azure Data Solution Certification / AWS Solution Architect Certification / Snowflake SnowPro® certification is desirable
Python / R-Programming / Visualization exposure is preferred
Experience:
• 10+ years of Software development with 6+ years of hands on experience in creating technical solutions on Cloud - Snowflake EDW / Informatica DEI / HVR • 6+ years of experience in design and development on SQL Server • 4+ years of experience in architecture definition and requirement development. • 2+ years of experience with visualization software (Tableau, Power BI, Spotfire, Qlikview, d3.js) is advantageous
Essential skills:
• Experience in working on Data Ingestion, Transformation and Modelling tools like Informatica DEI, Airflow, Paxata • Very good understanding on data integration from various systems viz., EDW platform (ADLS & Snowflake Landing Schema) using HVR and Informatica DEI • Working knowledge of cloud / Big data Platform like Azure or AWS • Solid hands-on experience of database governance including but not limited to SQL, Oracle, MySQL and open source technologies • Good at release management such as Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery (CICD) • Expertise on Design, development, deployment and operation of business intelligence (BI) solutions • Strong written and verbal communications skills. Ability to persuade, inform, and influence others based on technology solutions. • Ability to quickly adapt to new technologies, tools, and techniques • Strong business acumen, with ability to draw clear connections between data modeling activities and business challenges/opportunities • Team Player, open to feedback, and flexible & adaptable to changing needs. • Mentors and develops the technical skills of Analysts and Specialist.
Desired skills:
• Experience with the agile and DevOps methodologies • Experience with columnar DB like Enterprise HANA and predictive modeling using R or Python • Experience in migrating from on-premises to cloud e.g. move from on-premises Oracle to AWS Oracle RDS with little or no downtime • Developing IoT Connectivity Solutions using Azure event hub, Apache Kafka & NodeJS • Master Data Management (MDM)
Additional Information

Title: MEDICAL CODER
Description:
About Indegene:
Indegene is a specialized healthcare solutions company with a unique blend of life science domain expertise and state-of-the-art technology capabilities. Headquartered in Bangalore, with offices across the world, Indegene is partner to most of the world’s Top 25 pharma companies helping transform their commercial and medical operations.
As life sciences companies embrace digital and omni-channel marketing for more personalized customer engagement, Indegene helps enable this shift by integrating commercial content development with deep data, analytics and campaign expertise.
Across brands and geographies, we help some of the world’s largest pharma companies drive consolidation and excellence in omni-channel customer experiences by integrating data operations, and advanced analytics into the design and personalization of customer campaigns and creation of digital content. This is enabled by bringing together deep analytics expertise and contemporary AI and Big Data technology to establish Global Centres of Excellence for Marketing Operations.
Indegene has a strong and established business providing full-spectrum of business solutions for clinical, regulatory, safety, and medical affairs of Life sciences (pharmaceutical, devices, and biotech) companies worldwide from early drug development to mature products. Much like the commercial space, the R&D/Medical side of Pharma/Lifesciences is undergoing transformation at variable pace across the industry. Medical Organizations are increasingly looking to driving efficiencies and productivities in almost all areas of traditional work streams that are human/capital time intensive, while retaining high compliance to regulatory requirements.
Indegene has always been known for its strong domain expertise and is now driving for differentiated outcomes (reducing time-to-agency, enhanced productivities & efficiencies, higher accuracy and compliance) by disrupting the status quo in contextualizing contemporary, modern technologies (AI, ML, NLP) for life sciences by leveraging this expertise.
Further upstream in the pharma product lifecycle, we are helping companies to integrate multiple sources of clinical, safety and real world (electronic medical records, claims, wearables, etc.) data and perform nuanced, domain-specific analytics on them. By doing so, we are helping pharma and life sciences companies accelerate their clinical trials, detect safety signals and garner real world evidence to engage with external provider, patient and payer communities.
Indegene’s co-commercialization solutions bring together all the expertise mentioned above to help life sciences companies drive revenue growth for their brands across the lifecycle. Across a range of business needs such as white space coverage, augmentation of field force efforts, medical engagement, lead generation, patient adherence, consumer awareness, etc., we take end to end responsibility to drive auditable business outcomes (increased Rx and sales).
In several cases, our co-commercialization engagements are structured as outcomes-based contracts wherein Indegene is a gain-share/risk-share partner to life sciences companies. Our track record of success and proven ability to deliver the right content/service to the right person at the right time through the right channel has made us the partner of choice to life sciences companies for externalization of the sales and marketing of their products.

Job Description:
The roles and responsibilities of the Medical Coder include the following:

Good understanding of ICD-9/ICD-10 coding guidelines
Ability to effectively and accurately abstract ICD-9/ICD-10 codes for medical records, as identified in project guidelines
Thorough knowledge of medical terminology, anatomy and physiology
Ability to work independently
Ability to meet quality and productivity standards regularly and consistently
Ability to consistently adhere to the company’s HIPPA and PHI guidelines

Job Requirements:
Certified Professional Coder, Certified Coding Specialist, or Certified Coding Associate
ICD-10 certification or proficiency
Minimum 2 years of coding experience
Successful completion of coding skills assessment
Must possess latest ICD-9/ICD-10 CM code books
Basic knowledge of Microsoft Excel and data entry

Professional Skills:
Strong attention to detail
Knowledge of computer and basic data entry
Effective team player
Ability to work independently
Adaptive, flexible, and dependable

Title: Integration Specialist
Description:
This is an exciting opportunity as an Integration Specialist in Ivalua. You will be first point of contact between our technical clients integrating Ivalua products with their ERP and other internal and 3rd party systems. Ivalua is developing a new generation of Procurement technology products.
About Ivalua
A "Magic Quadrant" leader, Ivalua's solutions work in a complex global economy. Our innovative Procure-to-Pay solutions include automating customized workflows to request, procure, receive, and pay for goods and services across the enterprise, refining the procurement lifecycle while reducing cost and risk of spending on indirect goods, direct goods and services, and improving supplier collaboration.
About the Team
You will be part of the Professional Services Team whose mission is to successfully deliver our unique and configurable solution to customers and support our Partner community with high quality standards and strong commitment to excellence and efficiency. Our team is very hands-on with a strong mindset of problem solving – and has yet the ability to think holistically of the implementation and provide solutions that solve the customer long term challenges.
Our team works hard, plays hard and enjoys all indoor and outdoor activities that the company organizes from time to time, so that you can focus, work collaboratively, and be at your creative best.
Key Responsibilities:
Lead the end to end implementation of the integration work stream from the requirement gathering and data mapping to production delivery
Drive the design of data integration by interacting with the customer's technical resources, providing guidance on best practices, and leading and coordinating the effort on the technical design document
Build interfaces using Ivalua technical framework and/or review interface deliverable s built by Partners
Ensure technical standards and architectural best practices are maintained and optimize system integration performance.
Lead the testing effort and coordinate all system testing activities with customer and third-party technology
Guarantee successful deployment to Production
Skills You Need to Succeed
At least 4+ years' experience in web-based software development and software deployment processes
Technical skills: SQL Server, ETL, SFTP, FTPS, AS2, APIs, SOAP, REST, Web Services, CSV, XML, CXML, EDI
Broad knowledge of enterprise level, commercially available hardware and software products, operating systems, networking systems, and methodologies and tools for integrating web-based products
Customer facing and strong leadership skills
Some travel may be necessary (~20%)


Preferred Education:
Bachelor (BS) degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a closely related field or foreign equivalent
Watch the Ivalua Video: https://vimeo.com/363634218
Join Ivalua today and procure a great future for your career!

Title: Software Engineer in Test
Description:
Syniti, was founded to solve business’ complex data challenges, bringing synergy between data and business, delivering confidence and progress along clients’ business transformation journey. Through a combination of unique data expertise, services, and intelligent software leveraging artificial intelligence and machine learning, we help clients manage their data journey from data conversion to data quality, data archival and replication, master data management, analytics, information governance, and data strategy.
Utilizing the market’s top data specialists, validated industry knowledge and proven methodologies, Syniti has led thousands of successful data journey projects for Forbes Global 2000 organizations. SAP resells Advance Data Migration and Information Steward Accelerator by Syniti as SAP Solution Extensions.
Syniti is a purpose-driven company. “We’re embracing the future together as one – with our employees, clients and partners – accelerating global and human progress, one data challenge at a time.”
Headquartered in Boston, MA, Syniti operates in 25 countries around the globe.
POSITION SUMMARY
The main responsibility of the Software Developer Engineer in Test is to perform testing and quality assurance for our on-premise software. This position requires working with all stakeholders involved in the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), primarily the Senior Developers, Quality Engineers, and Product Managers.
This position is 100% remote and will have moderate supervision, therefore excellent time management skills are required.
The Engineering Team for this position is located in North America (NA), therefore, there will be a requirement to adjust work hours to have reasonable overlap with the NA work schedule.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
Design, develop, maintain, and implement test plans and automated tests and contribute to continuous delivery of our software
Develop and maintain a current and thorough understanding of our on-premise software
Maintain and improve our current automation framework
Thoroughly analyze test execution results to ensure that the work products comply with approved design and documented requirements
Assist in the gathering and analyzing of testing metrics and suggest process improvements to improve the software development and testing processes including performance testing and monitoring
Execute Integration, Regression and Acceptance testing
Automated and manual tests
Analyze and resolve test failures
Support the Development Team by taking on additional responsibilities, as needed
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related technical field
2+ years of experience in SDET/CI/CD/Test Automation, Software Development or Test Framework Development
Experience using automation testing tools/frameworks/languages such as Cucumber, Python, Ruby, Capybara, JMeter, etc
Experience with formal QA testing processes
Experience with test case and test scenario writing – both manual and automated
Experience writing automated tests for web front ends, web services, APIs, and databases
Experience with MS SQL Server and proficient database skills
Knowledge of code versioning tools such as Git and GitHub
Knowledge of continuous integration tools such as Jenkins
Familiarity with AWS tools and services (EC2 and S3 a plus)
Familiarity with Jira or other Agile software development tools for task management
Excellent Soft Skills:
Communications: Ability to communicate clearly and efficiently to team members and clients, verbally and in writing. Able to present ideas in a variety of ways depending upon audience and context. Excellent active listening skills
Organizational Skills: Can plan and prioritize work. Follows tasks to their logical conclusion and makes sure that everything has been done to the right standard. Strong attention to detail
Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to analyze problems and determine root cause, generating alternatives, evaluating and selecting alternatives and implementing solutions
Results oriented: Able to drive things forward regardless of personal interest in the tasks
Ability to work independently and as a team member in a remote environment:
Experience using Google Meet, Zoom, Slack or similar technologies
Ability and desire to learn new software and technologies, with a detail-oriented perspective
If you are interested in this or any one of the exciting career opportunities at Syniti®, please go to www.syniti.com and view our Careers section, where you should complete the on-line application process.
